general_texts:
Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction. 


Prior to transferring to San José State University all transfers must earn at least 60 transferable semester units (90 quarter), including the CSU four basic skill courses required for CSU admission eligibility (except majors which have an approved CSU GE 1B waiver). Within those 60 semester/90 quarter units, students are strongly encouraged to complete the following: 


1. Lower Division Major Course Requirements (especially for STEM Majors): Complete as many of the lower division courses required for the major as possible. Many of these courses may be double counted as part of the CSU GE 34 semester unit requirements. The lower division major courses for this major are shown below. 


2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.
Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement - including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites - must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

﻿The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.

  •  All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).


  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)



  • General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of at least 12 units of the following courses or equivalents:

ANTH 11 Cultural Anthropology

ANTH 12 Introduction to Human Evolution

ANTH 13 Archaeology

STAT 95, SOCI 15, UNVS 15, or equivalent of Statistics




If a class is being used to meet a major or minor requirement – whether it is a prerequisite, preparation course, or support course – the class must be completed for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

majors.major: Art, Concentration in Digital Media Art, B.F.A.
general_texts:
Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction.

2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

No portfolios are required at the time of application for admission to SJSU. Major requirements for the first wo years of study for BA Art/Studio Practice and all BFA degrees are very similar so that students have time to choose the right path and can apply for the BFA, if they choose to do so. At the time BFA program applicants must meet the following departmental requirements:


  1. Have completed, be currently enrolled in, or planning to enroll within the following two semesters in all coursework in the common preparation for the BA and BFA Art majors (25-28 units of drawing, digital media, photography, sculpture, art history, ART 1, ART 2, ART 3 and ART 100W with a minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Also recommended, are three to six additional units from the desired BFA concentration area.
  2. Pass the BFA – Art admissions review. During the review, which is held in October and March each year, images of the applicant’s creative work are reviewed by the art faculty to determine if the work demonstrates the creative level expected of BFA candidates. Instructions are available on the Art and Art History Department website.


Students complete the BFA Art program with a capstone project, for which each candidate prepares an individual art exhibit to demonstrate the candidate’s professional competence.


Students must maintain a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in all art/design courses; failing this, the BFA status will be changed to one of the BA Art programs.



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement - including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites - must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

  • Pass the BFA Art admissions review. During the review, which is held in October and March each year, images of the applicant’s creative work are reviewed by the art faculty to determine if the work demonstrates the creative level expected of BFA candidates. Instructions are available on the Art and Art History Department website.


Students complete the BFA program with a capstone project, for which each candidate prepares an individual art exhibit to demonstrate the candidate’s professional competence.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement - including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites - must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

majors.major: Business Administration, Concentration in General Business, B.S. (SJSU Online)
general_texts:
The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.

  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).


  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:


GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)



  • General Education Area F Ethnic Studies – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of at least 22 units of the following courses (or equivalents). The following preparation for the major and required for the major courses must be completed with a grade of “C or better”: ENGL 2, MATH 70, BUS1 20, and BUS2 90.

﻿

ECON 1A

ECON 1B

MATH 70 OR MATH 71 OR MATH 30

BUS1 20

BUS1 21

BUS3 80

BUS2 90

BUS4 91L


﻿

Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

Business Law and the Legal Environment

general_texts:
Undergraduate Advisement


Students wishing to major in chemistry should confer with one of the department advisors when entering the university. Students' goals will determine whether they opt for the BS or BA degree, with possible specialization in biochemistry. Students who transfer into these programs should be aware that general chemistry and a number of preparation courses, especially the mathematics and physics requirements, should be started during their first two years. If students transfer at the junior level without most of these courses completed, more than four semesters at SJSU may be required to complete the degree. 


All chemistry majors must meet with their advisors every semester. This mandatory advising session is necessary to remove the advising hold preventing registration for the following semester. 


Prerequisite Requirements: Any course that is prerequisite to any Chemistry course must be passed with a grade of "C or better" (C- not accepted).




﻿Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

Undergraduate Advisement


Students wishing to major in chemistry should confer with one of the department advisors when entering the university. Students' goals will determine whether they opt for the BS or BA degree, with possible specialization in biochemistry. Students who transfer into these programs should be aware that general chemistry and a number of preparation courses, especially the mathematics and physics requirements, should be started during their first two years. If students transfer at the junior level without most of these courses completed, more than four semesters at SJSU may be required to complete the degree. 


All chemistry majors must meet with their advisors every semester. This mandatory advising session is necessary to remove the advising hold preventing registration for the following semester. 



Prerequisite Requirements: Any course that is prerequisite to any Chemistry course must be passed with a grade of "C or better" (C- not accepted).



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

This major is designed for students interested in teaching elementary school or middle school. The following course work, offered by the Department of Child and Adolescent Development, satisfied San Jose State University’s requirements for a BA in Child and Adolescent Development (CHAD) with Preparation for Teaching. Students who are transfers or who are changing into this major, in consultation with a department advisor, identify the course work appropriate for the individual. Information about CHAD advising and making an appointment can be found on the department website.


Maintaining a minimum grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.87 and completion of the program will not guarantee admission to the credential program. Like all other applicants, students must meet credential program standards and undergo screening for admission. See the Teacher Preparation section of the catalog for information on application and admission to credential programs.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

A grade of “C-“or better is required for courses being used to meet any requirement in any minor or major offered by the Department of Computer Science, including Major Preparation courses.



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (no Credit/No Credit).


﻿

Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction. 


Prior to transferring to San José State University all transfers must earn at least 60 transferable semester units (90 quarter), including the CSU four basic skill courses required for CSU admission eligibility (except majors which have an approved CSU GE 1B waiver). Within those 60 semester/90 quarter units, students are strongly encouraged to complete the following: 


1. Lower Division Major Course Requirements (especially for STEM Majors): Complete as many of the lower division courses required for the major as possible. Many of these courses may be double counted as part of the CSU GE 34 semester unit requirements. The lower division major courses for this major are shown below. 


2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

A grade of “C-“or better is required for courses being used to meet any requirement in any minor or major offered by the Department of Computer Science, including Major Preparation courses.


The BS Computer Science Electives Requirement (referenced below as "Science Electives") - 8 semester/12 quarter units of lower division science course work must be completed. At least six (6) of those units must be fulfilled by the courses listed below. 


The remaining units may be satisfied by GE Areas 5A, 5B, and 5C. Courses that count towards the 6-unit requirement are: BIOL 30, BIOL 31, CHEM 1A, GEOL 1, GEOL 4L, GEOL 7, METR 10, PHYS 50, PHYS 51, PHYS 52. 



Note: The Preparation for the Major and Requirements in the Major sections must include at least 37 units of upper division mathematics and computer science course work not to include CS 100W taken at SJSU. Please see your CS advisor after transferring to SJSU.



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

Design Drawing – Based on your Area of Specialization, complete one course.

Area of Specialization – Complete one Area of Specialization. Specializations area cluster of courses used by departments for advising purposes. Specializations will not appear on transcripts or diplomas. Please see your advisor for details.

university_course.title: Introduction of Interior Design and Architecture

general_texts:
This major provides broad background in the earth sciences. Students interested in teaching science in high school or middle school should take the specified elective courses (consult with the advisor as needed). The Earth System Science degree will prepare students for career options including geohazard assessment, environmental geology, climate change and environmental remediation, water resource management, geoscience consulting, Earth Science teaching, and other career opportunities that center the societal-Earth connection.



Students must complete one of the following (4 units):

GEOL 1 - General Geology (4 units)

GEOL 7 - Earth, Time and Life (4 units)

﻿GEOL 3 - Planet Earth (3 units) AND GEOL 4L -Earth Systems Lab (1 unit)





Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.

  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).
  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)


  • General Education Area F Ethnic Studies – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of at least 12 units of the following courses (or equivalents) with a grade of “C- or better”:

ECON 1A

ECON 1B

MATH 71

Statistics - STAT 95, BUS2 90, SOCI 15


﻿



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction. 


Prior to transferring to San José State University all transfers must earn at least 60 transferable semester units (90 quarter), including the CSU four basic skill courses required for CSU admission eligibility (except majors which have an approved CSU GE 1B waiver). Within those 60 semester/90 quarter units, students are strongly encouraged to complete the following: 


1. Lower Division Major Course Requirements (especially for STEM Majors): Complete as many of the lower division courses required for the major as possible. Many of these courses may be double counted as part of the CSU GE 34 semester unit requirements. The lower division major courses for this major are shown below. 


2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

general_texts:
This program is currently not accepting students.



The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.



  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better. However, 63 semester units of lower-division may be completed at the community college.
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements, except for GE Area A3 which is waived for this degree (36 units). Of the 36 units, 15 units are fulfilled by math, science, engineering, and a second semester English composition.


  • The CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better for admission:

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking - This requirement is waived for this degree.

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)


  • General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of at least 29 units of the Math and Science courses (or equivalents):


BIOL 10

CHEM 30A OR CHEM 1A OR CHEM 1B

MATH 30

MATH 31

MATH 32

MATH 33A OR MATH 33LA OR MATH 42

PHYS 50

PHYS 51



  • Completion of at least 12 units of the Engineering courses (or equivalents):


CMPE 30 OR CS 46A

EE 98

ENGR 10

MATE 25 OR CE 95




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

general_texts:
Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction. 


Prior to transferring to San José State University all transfers must earn at least 60 transferable semester units (90 quarter), including the CSU four basic skill courses required for CSU admission eligibility (except majors which have an approved CSU GE 1B waiver). Within those 60 semester/90 quarter units, students are strongly encouraged to complete the following: 


1. Lower Division Major Course Requirements (especially for STEM Majors): Complete as many of the lower division courses required for the major as possible. Many of these courses may be double counted as part of the CSU GE 34 semester unit requirements. The lower division major courses for this major are shown below. 


2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

To graduate in a timely manner, students are encouraged to take as many of the following articulated courses as possible prior to transfer.



The following course in preparation for the major must be completed with a “C- or better”: ENGL 1B.



The following required in the major lower division core must be completed with a “C- or better”: MATH 30, MATH 31, MATH 32, MATH 33A, PHYS 50, PHYS 51, CHEM 1A, CHEM 1B, CE 99 (or CE 95), ME 20, MATE 25, and ENGR 10.



Prerequisite Requirement: Any course that is a prerequisite to any Chemistry course must be passed with a grade of “C or better” (C- is not accepted).




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).





﻿

2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. 3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

West Valley College students that wish to transfer a Parks Minor in Environmental Studies will need to complete the following:


Please select a minimum 9 units from the following West Valley College courses:

PMGT 10 - Introduction to Park Management (3 units)

PMGT 11 - Park Communications (2 units)

PMGT 14 - Conservation of Our Natural Resources (3 units)

PMGT 15A - Duties of the Park Professional (3 units)

PMGT 15B - Natural and Cultural Resources (3 units)

PMGT 15C - Introduction to Park Maintenance (3 units)

PMGT 18 - Park Planning and Design (2 units)

BIOL 14 - California Plants and Animals (3 units) AND either GEOL 1A - Physical Geology (4 units) OR GEOL 15 - Geology of California (3 units)
Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

The Environmental Studies, Preparation for Teaching, BA is designed to prepare students for elementary or middle school teaching. The coursework satisfies University requirements for a BA in Environmental Studies and is a program approved by the Teacher Credentialing in the State of California (CTC) for waiver of the Commission-approved subject matter examination (CSET for Multiple Subjects). Thus, students completing this program are eligible to apply for the Multiple Subject Teaching Credential (K-8) program.


Students completing this program must also meet all other credential program standards. See the Teacher Preparation section of the catalog for information on application and admission to credential programs.

The Geography, BA degree program prepares students to understand the environment around us and interpret human and non-human patterns across the Earth’s surface. The major allows flexibility in course selection while providing a strong foundation in human, physical, and regional aspects of the discipline. Geography at SJSU also features a strong technology component based on applications of Geographic Information Systems (GIS). Geography is essential to the growing need for global literacy and our faculty is committed to working with students to develop the skills that will serve them well in a career or in graduate studies. For additional information review the department web site located at http://www.sjsu.edu/geography.

general_texts:
The B.S. in Geology offers a program with depth in all aspects of geology. It is the curriculum traditionally required for admission to graduate programs in geology or geophysics. Graduates are employed as entry-level geologists and technicians in engineering, geophysical, and geological firms, or local and state government agencies.



Elective Courses - MATH 31 recommended for graduate school or technical careers.


﻿

Students must maintain a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in all major preparation and major required courses. Students who drop below a 3.0 for two consecutive semesters will have their degree status changed from the BFA to the Design Studies, BA program.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Admission to San José State is competitive in all majors. SJSU continues to have more qualified applicants than available new student spaces. Because of this, SJSU is an impacted campus with impacted programs. For the most current information regarding admission impaction at SJSU please visit our website Admissions Impaction. 


Prior to transferring to San José State University all transfers must earn at least 60 transferable semester units (90 quarter), including the CSU four basic skill courses required for CSU admission eligibility (except majors which have an approved CSU GE 1B waiver). Within those 60 semester/90 quarter units, students are strongly encouraged to complete the following: 


1. Lower Division Major Course Requirements (especially for STEM Majors): Complete as many of the lower division courses required for the major as possible. Many of these courses may be double counted as part of the CSU GE 34 semester unit requirements. The lower division major courses for this major are shown below. 


2. General Education (GE) Requirements: Complete all the CSU GE requirements at the community. The approved courses for each area can be found at ASSIST.org under the link for your college. Many of these courses may be double counted to meet the major requirements shown below, so choose your courses wisely. Some SJSU majors which meet GE requirements within the majors are noted on the Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements page in our catalog. Please see your college counselor or advisor to review your general education requirements before transferring to San José State University. 


3. Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

American Institutions


Select any approved combination of community college courses certified to meet the CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals requirement (US 1 & US 2 & US 3). Only if the combinations are certified to meet 6 units of Area 4, and the US-1, US-2 and US-3 to clear the American Institution Requirement.


  • US 1 - Historical development of American institutions and ideals.
  • US 2 - U.S. Constitution and government.
  • US 3 - California state and local government.



See courses approved for this area at your community college (under the CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Course link in Assist).




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.



Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.


  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).


  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)



  • General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.



  • It is highly recommended that students complete all lower division General Education and the Physical Education requirements before applying for admissions.


  • Completion of at least 5 units of the following courses (or equivalents), each with a grade of C- or better grade:


﻿ISDA 20A

ISDA 20B

ISDA 20C

ISDA 20D





Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

majors.major: Interdisciplinary Studies, Concentration in Health Care Leadership, B.S. (SJSU Online)
general_texts:
The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.



The Interdisciplinary Studies, Concentration in Health Care Leadership offered by the College of Health and Human Sciences is designed to give you the knowledge and skills you’ll need to prepare you for professional health care careers in a global market. Coursework focuses on health care leadership skills, financial principles, management strategies and standards to improve patient care. You’ll take courses in the physical and social sciences giving you a well-rounded education to pursue careers in allied health roles or to prepare you for entry into a variety of health-related graduate degree programs. The flexibility offered by the interdisciplinary degree in Health Care Leadership, and the practical skills learned in the program, lead to may exciting careers in fields as diverse as public health, health education and administration, marketing and public relations, media, policy, research, clinical care, biotechnology, pharmaceutical development and sales, worksite wellness, politics, government, and environmental health among others.


 

Admission Requirements:

 

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.


  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average

of 2.0 or better

  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).

 

  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:


GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)

  • Complete one course from: STAT 95 OR PH 67

  

General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.

Second Course in English Composition highly recommended: All students are strongly encouraged to complete a second English composition course as part of their lower division GE prior to transferring to SJSU (either to meet CSU GE Area 1B or 3B). Complete this course with a grade of “C-” or better for the greatest success in passing a Writing in the Disciplines (100W) course with a “C” or better (C- not accepted) at SJSU.


4. American Institutions Requirement (US 1, US 2, and US 3 must be completed): This requirement is normally two courses and can be taken as part of your CSU GE requirements (Area 4 and sometimes Area 3). The approved courses can be found at ASSIST.org under the link "CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals Courses" for your college. 


5. Graduation Requirement - Physical Education (PE): All undergraduate students who matriculate at SJSU are required to complete two units of physical education from Kinesiology/Dance activity courses, unless the major program has an approved PE waiver. Majors which have approved PE waivers are noted on the "Exceptions for University Graduation Requirements" page in our catalog.

Students must maintain a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in all major preparation and major required courses. Students who drop below a 3.0 for two consecutive semesters will have their degree status changed from the BFA to the Design Studies, BA.

﻿



Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

majors.major: Journalism and Mass Communication - Public Relations, B.S. (SJSU Online)
general_texts:
The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.


  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better.
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (34 units).


  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)


  • General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of at least 9 units of the following courses (or equivalents) with a grade of “C-“ or better:


JOUR 61

MCOM 63

MCOM 72


﻿


Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Listed below are lower division course requirements for the BS in Kinesiology with specialization in Exercise and Fitness, Inclusive Physical Activity in Communities (IPAC), Rehabilitation Sciences, Sport Management and Culture, Individualized Studies, or Transfer Curriculum Studies (students with an AA-T in Kinesiology).



  • Students in this major must complete all course requirements for the major (All courses in Preparation, Core, Concentration/Specialization) with a "C- grade or better" to graduate. 



Physical Activity Courses: Kinesiology majors are required to complete 4 different activities in 4 different movement areas (In addition to the university 2-unit physical education university graduation requirement). The SJSU activity movement areas are: 


  • Area 1 Combative (referenced below as number 6 Personal Defense or Combatives group)
  • Area 2 Fitness (referenced below as number 7)
  • Area 3 Dance (referenced below as number 8)
  • Area 4 Individual/Dual (referenced below as number 9)
  • Area 5 Team (referenced below as number 10 Team Sports group)
  • Area 6 Adventure (referenced below as number 11)


Area of Specialization: Choose one area of study from:

  • Exercise and Fitness Specialist
  • Inclusive Physical Activity in Communities (IPAC)
  • Rehabilitation Sciences
  • Sport Management and Culture
  • Individualized Studies – The coursework for this specialization will be selected in consultation with the students’ academic advisor.
  • Sport Management and Culture Specialization: A maximum of 6 semester units may be taken at the lower-division level OR a Business Minor, Sociology Minor, Psychology Minor, Journalism Minor or other minor selected in consultation with Departmental Advisor.

 

  • Transfer Curriculum Studies – Designed for students with an AA-T in Kinesiology.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

American Institutions Requirement:

Select any approved combination of community college courses certified to meet the CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals requirement (US 1 & US 2 & US 3). Only if the combinations are certified to meet six units of Area 4, and the US-1, US-2 and US-3 to clear the American Institution Requirement.


  • US 1 Historical development of American institutions and ideals.
  • US 2 U.S. Constitution and government.
  • US 3 California state and local government.


See courses approved for this area at your community college (under CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals (CSU AI).


Science:

Number 4A - Select CHEM 30A OR select an Area 5A course with a 5C Lab.

Number 4B - Select ENVS 10 OR select an Area 5B course with a 5C Lab.

Number 4C - Complete PHYS 1.



Visual and Performing Arts: Number 5 below Visual and Performing Arts - Students must complete six units in two different art disciplines.


﻿

American Institutions Requirement:

Select any approved combination of community college courses certified to meet the CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals requirement (US 1 & US 2 & US 3). Only if the combinations are certified to meet six units of Area 4, and the US-1, US-2 and US-3 to clear the American Institution Requirement.


  • US 1 Historical development of American institutions and ideals.
  • US 2 U.S. Constitution and government.
  • US 3 California state and local government.


See courses approved for this area at your community college (under CSU US History, Constitution, and American Ideals (CSU AI).

Number 4A - Select CHEM 30A OR select an Area 5A course with a 5C Lab.

Number 4B - Select ENVS 10 OR select an Area 5B course with a 5C Lab.

Number 4C - Complete PHYS 1.



Visual and Performing Arts: Number 5 below Visual and Performing Arts - Students must complete six units in two different art disciplines.


﻿

general_texts:
The General Education Basic Skills and American Institution requirements should be completed prior to taking courses in the major.


Major Preparation - Students must meet one of the following criteria:


For students for whom English is not the native language, one year of college level English study may fulfill this requirement.


  • One year of college level language other than student’s native language.
  • Demonstrated equivalent competence.
  • One year of college level American Sign Language.



Electives in the Major: Elective courses (up to 3 units) from other departments such as World Languages and Literatures, English, Communication Studies, Computer Science, Psychology, Philosophy, Anthropology, and Communicative Disorders can also be taken with prior advisor approval.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

All courses in the preparation and major (all courses in preparation and core) must be completed with a grade of "C- or better".



Music Electives - Take 10 semester units (or 15 quarter units) from at least two of the following categories (Beginning Methods and Techniques and Chamber Music) to be selected in consultation with an advisor directed towards one of the capstone projects (5 additional units of upper division to be taken at SJSU after transfer).



Beginning Methods and Techniques: MUSC 25C is subject to Keyboard Placement Exam. Applied Lessons by audition and special permission from Director. You may choose no more than four semester (or six quarter) units from this list of courses. Chamber Music Maximum of two semester units (or 3 quarter units) can be counted toward major. Ensembles Maximum of four semester units (or 6 quarter units) can be counted toward the major.

All Music majors must demonstrate an acceptable level of performance ability in applied area offered in the curriculum.  All entering transfer students must perform an audition for the appropriate applied music committee. Also note that the MUSC 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B, 4A and 4B are courses which are subject to completion of theory placement exam.  



PREPARATION FOR THE MAJOR: Students must complete a piano proficiency requirement which may be satisfied with completion of MUSC 25A, MUSC 25B and MUSC 25C, or qualified students may test out by performing required skills for the piano faculty at SJSU. Music Education Concentration – Select an area of specialization from either the Instrumental (referenced below as Music Education - Instrumental) OR the Choral/General (referenced below as Music Education - Choral). 





Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

Choose an area of specialization from below. Area specializations are a cluster of courses departments use for advising purposes, they will not appear on the transcripts or diplomas.

INFORMATION FOR THIS MAJOR IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE - PLEASE CHECK THE WEB SITE ON A REGULAR BASIS.SEE THE SCHOOL OF NURSING'S WEB SITE for regular nursing applicants (We have a separate RN-to-BSN application process): www.sjsu.edu/nursing for detailed information and updates about minimal grades for the 8 prerequisites, which are a part of the impaction criteria for eligibility for applying to the nursing major.


Test of Essential Academic Skills (TEAS) Exam: The minimum score for the TEAS test is 84 (on version 7 of the TEAS test) and regardless of the version of the TEAS exam, it can only be taken a maximum of two times within five years of application. Files are reviewed twice a year with specified posted deadlines. Monthly 2-hour group advising sessions are strongly recommended and dates/times are posted on the School's web site, www.sjsu.edu/nursing, select "Future Student Advising".


All materials in the BS information packet should be reviewed from the web page prior to attending group advising. The TEAS test should be taken approximately 3-5 months prior to applying to the nursing major (see http://testing.sjsu.edu). All students must be fully immunized and have a clear background check within 2 weeks, once accepted into program. All 8 prerequisites must be completed and have a minimum of 3.3 GPA to apply to Nursing.


Please Note: Applicants must have minimum GPAs in certain areas, to be eligible to apply. It also means that the School of Nursing's prerequisite courses will be in alignment with other CSU campuses offering nursing as a major. Check with the School of Nursing's web site frequently regarding the anticipated changes. The student must apply to the university, as well as the School of Nursing for admission. Students must maintain a minimum grade of "C" or better or "Credit" in all preparation/prerequisite courses for the nursing major.



All courses required in the major (preparation, major, and electives) require a grade of "C or better".




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).

general_texts:
The mission of SJSU Online is to expand higher education access and degree attainment for learners requiring a fully online degree pathway. This upper-division degree completion program is offered through a special session that requires a separate application process.


Admission Requirements:

Transfer students who meet the following requirements will be considered for admission to this program.


  • All applicants are required to have 60 transferable semester or 90 quarter units with an overall grade point average of 2.0 or better.
  • All applicants must have completed the core lower division General Education requirements (39 units).


  • All four CSU approved basic skills courses must be completed with a grade of C- or better:

﻿

GE Area 1A (formerly Area A2) English Composition

GE Area 1B (formerly Area A3) Critical Thinking

GE Area 1C (formerly Area A1) Oral Communication

GE Area 2 (formerly Area B4) Mathematical Concepts and Quantitative Reasoning (above the level of intermediate algebra)



  • General Education Area 6 Ethnic Studies (formerly Area F) – must be completed with a grade of C- or better at San Jose State University.


  • Completion of 19-21 major preparation units of the following courses or equivalents. Students in this major must earn a grade of "C or better" in each of the courses in the preparation for the major.


BIOL 21

BIOL 65

CHEM 30A

PH 1

PH 15 OR CHAD 70

PH 67, STAT 95, OR UNVS 15

PH 99

Choose one Human Biology course: PH 52 OR BIOL 21.

Choose one Science course: BIOL 65, BIOL 66, CHEM 1A, OR CHEM 30A.




Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).


﻿

This major is designed for students interested in teaching history, political science (government), economics, or ethnic studies in high school or middle school. The following coursework satisfies San Jose State University’s requirements for a BA in Social Science Preparation for Teaching. The BA Social Science Preparation for Teaching, offered by the Department of History, is an approved program by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CCTC). Students completing the program qualify for a waiver of the subject matter examination (CSET for Social Science) required to earn a teaching credential.



Maintaining a minimum grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.75 and completion of the program will not guarantee admission to the credential program. Like all other applicants, students must meet credential program standards and undergo screening for admission. See “How to Become a Teacher” for information on application and admission to credential programs.



History and Social Science

Area 4 Social and Behavioral Sciences and American Institutions, 6 semester units from:


Select any approved combination of community college courses as certified to meet the CSU American History, US Constitution and Government, and California State and Local Government requirement (US 1 & US 2 & US 3) only if the combinations are certified to meet 6 units of Area 4 (and sometimes Area 3) and the US1, US2, and US3 to satisfy the American Institutions requirement.


  • US 1 – American History
  • US 2 – U.S. Constitution and Government
  • US 3 – California State and Local Government






Any course used to satisfy a major or minor requirement – including support courses, preparation courses, and prerequisites – must be taken for a letter grade (not Credit/No Credit).
